org.billtorcaso.kutils
Class StopwatchFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.billtorcaso.kutils.StopwatchFactory

@ThreadSafe
public final class StopwatchFactory
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the factory for Stopwatch objects.

Use the class-static method Stopwatch.stopwatchCreate() to get a Stopwatch object.

Use the class-static method Stopwatch.stopwatchCreateNoOp to get a no-op Stopwatch object. Use this when you do not want to record anything but your code is written to make Stopwatch calls.

See Also:
Stopwatch, StopwatchInstance

Constructor Summary
private StopwatchFactory()
          The constructor of StopwatchFactory is private, in order to make the class a singleton with services provided only through class-static methods.

Constructor Detail

StopwatchFactory

private StopwatchFactory()
The constructor of StopwatchFactory is private, in order to make the class a singleton with services provided only through class-static methods.

Method Detail

stopwatchCreate

public static Stopwatch stopwatchCreate(java.lang.String title)
This factory method is the only public way to create a functioning Stopwatch object. The returned object is a Stopwatch object with its title set to "Creation:" + title

Returns:
a reference to a Stopwatch object

stopwatchCreateNoOp

public static Stopwatch stopwatchCreateNoOp(java.lang.String title)
This factory method is the only public way to create a non-functioning, placeholder Stopwatch object. The returned object is a Stopwatch object, and the return values from its methods are always 0L, "", or an empty List.

Returns:
a reference to a Stopwatch object

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
main() runs a small exercise of Stopwatch methods. It writes to System.out, and you are expected to compare the output with a known-good text file.

Run it as 

     $ java -jar kutils_whatever_you_named_it.jar   org.billtorcaso.kutils.StopwatchFactory;

     or

     $ java -cp .   org.billtorcaso.kutils.StopwatchFactory;

Parameters:
args - an array of String objects.
